title: How to Restore Mahogany

steps.headline: Mix 1 tablespoon of vinegar with 236ml (1/2 pint) or water.
Wash the mahogany furniture with this mixture.
steps.description: Rub dry with a soft cloth.

steps.headline: Wipe over the cleaned furniture with turpentine.
steps.description: Polish with a dry, clean cloth.

steps.headline: Soak a cloth in linseed (flaxseed) oil.
steps.description: Use this cloth to rub over the furniture vigorously. Leave in place for 12 hours.

steps.headline: Wipe off the linseed oil layer.
steps.description: Use a lint-free cloth to buff to a shine.

steps.headline: Wipe over the furniture again with a clean cloth that has been dipped in warm water.
steps.description: Polish well. The mahogany should look much better now.

text: Mix 1 tablespoon of vinegar with 236ml (1/2 pint) or water.  Wash the mahogany furniture with this mixture. Rub dry with a soft cloth. Wipe over the cleaned furniture with turpentine. Polish with a dry, clean cloth. Soak a cloth in linseed (flaxseed) oil. Use this cloth to rub over the furniture vigorously. Leave in place for 12 hours. Wipe off the linseed oil layer. Use a lint-free cloth to buff to a shine. Wipe over the furniture again with a clean cloth that has been dipped in warm water. Polish well. The mahogany should look much better now.
